input: Design a comprehensive fintech content campaign that includes research, produces various content formats, ensures cross-channel consistency, and targets specific measurable outcomes.

inputs.name: Target Audience Profile
inputs.input_data: Demographics, financial behavior patterns, pain points, preferred channels

inputs.name: Historical Customer Data
inputs.input_data: Transaction records, user engagement logs, segmentation tags

inputs.name: Competitor Content Analysis
inputs.input_data: Competitor blog posts, social media activity, SEO keywords

inputs.name: Brand Guidelines
inputs.input_data: Tone of voice, visual assets, compliance requirements

inputs.name: KPI Definitions
inputs.input_data: Conversion rate targets, engagement benchmarks, ROI thresholds

inputs.name: Channel-Specific Requirements
inputs.input_data: Platform style guides (e.g., LinkedIn vs. TikTok), ad specs

inputs.name: Budget Allocation
inputs.input_data: Spend limits for ads, influencer partnerships, production

inputs.name: Campaign Timeline
inputs.input_data: Launch dates, content refresh cycles, reporting deadlines

inputs.name: Website Analytics
inputs.input_data: Traffic sources, bounce rates, funnel drop-offs

inputs.name: Audience Personas
inputs.source_origin: Derived from Target Audience Profile (1) and Historical Customer Data (2)

inputs.name: Content Calendar
inputs.source_origin: Derived from Campaign Timeline (8) and Channel-Specific Requirements (6)

inputs.name: Engagement Metrics Baseline
inputs.source_origin: Derived from Website Analytics (9) and Competitor Content Analysis (3)

execution_plan.raw_response:
Inputs:  
1. **Target Audience Profile**  
   Source Type: USER-CONTROLLED  
   Source Origin: Marketing Team  
   Input Data: Demographics, financial behavior patterns, pain points, preferred channels  
   Bound Reference: None  
   Note: Requires explicit user provision or linkage.  

2. **Historical Customer Data**  
   Source Type: SYSTEM-RETRIEVABLE  
   Source Origin: CRM Database (e.g., Salesforce)  
   Input Data: Transaction records, user engagement logs, segmentation tags  
   Bound Reference: None  

3. **Competitor Content Analysis**  
   Source Type: SYSTEM-RETRIEVABLE  
   Source Origin: SEMrush/Ahrefs API  
   Input Data: Competitor blog posts, social media activity, SEO keywords  
   Bound Reference: None  

4. **Brand Guidelines**  
   Source Type: USER-CONTROLLED  
   Source Origin: Internal Design Team  
   Input Data: Tone of voice, visual assets, compliance requirements  
   Bound Reference: None  
   Note: Requires explicit user provision or linkage.  

5. **KPI Definitions**  
   Source Type: USER-CONTROLLED  
   Source Origin: Executive Stakeholders  
   Input Data: Conversion rate targets, engagement benchmarks, ROI thresholds  
   Bound Reference: None  
   Note: Requires explicit user provision or linkage.  

6. **Channel-Specific Requirements**  
   Source Type: USER-CONTROLLED  
   Source Origin: Marketing Team  
   Input Data: Platform style guides (e.g., LinkedIn vs. TikTok), ad specs  
   Bound Reference: None  
   Note: Requires explicit user provision or linkage.  

7. **Budget Allocation**  
   Source Type: USER-CONTROLLED  
   Source Origin: Finance Department  
   Input Data: Spend limits for ads, influencer partnerships, production  
   Bound Reference: None  
   Note: Requires explicit user provision or linkage.  

8. **Campaign Timeline**  
   Source Type: USER-CONTROLLED  
   Source Origin: Project Manager  
   Input Data: Launch dates, content refresh cycles, reporting deadlines  
   Bound Reference: None  
   Note: Requires explicit user provision or linkage.  

9. **Website Analytics**  
   Source Type: SYSTEM-RETRIEVABLE  
   Source Origin: Google Analytics 4  
   Input Data: Traffic sources, bounce rates, funnel drop-offs  
   Bound Reference: None  

10. **Regulatory Compliance Rules**  
    Source Type: SYSTEM-RETRIEVABLE  
    Source Origin: Legal Database (e.g., GDPR, FINRA)  
    Input Data: Disclosure requirements, restricted terminology  
    Bound Reference: None  

11. **Audience Personas**  
    Source Type: DERIVABLE  
    Source Origin: Derived from Target Audience Profile (1) and Historical Customer Data (2)  
    Input Data: Synthesized behavioral archetypes  
    Bound Reference: Inputs 1, 2  
    Note: [DEPTH STOP - Terminal input, do not further decompose]  

12. **Content Calendar**  
    Source Type: DERIVABLE  
    Source Origin: Derived from Campaign Timeline (8) and Channel-Specific Requirements (6)  
    Input Data: Scheduled posts, format-channel mappings  
    Bound Reference: Inputs 6, 8  
    Note: [DEPTH STOP - Terminal input, do not further decompose]  

13. **Engagement Metrics Baseline**  
    Source Type: DERIVABLE  
    Source Origin: Derived from Website Analytics (9) and Competitor Content Analysis (3)  
    Input Data: Average CTR, time-on-page benchmarks  
    Bound Reference: Inputs 3, 9  
    Note: [DEPTH STOP - Terminal input, do not further decompose]  

---

Outputs:  
1. **Campaign Strategy Document** (PDF)  
2. **Content Asset Repository** (Blog Posts, Infographics, Video Scripts)  
3. **Cross-Channel Analytics Dashboard** (Google Data Studio)  
4. **CMS Update Log** (Content Management System)  
5. **Social Media Posting Schedule** (CSV/ICS)  
6. **Compliance Audit Report** (PDF)  

---

Steps:  
**Step 1**: Audience Research Synthesis  
Uses: Target Audience Profile (1), Historical Customer Data (2)  
Action: Cluster demographics and behavior data to refine segmentation  
Produces: Audience Personas (11)  
Stores/Sends To: Internal Wiki  

**Step 2**: Competitive Benchmarking  
Uses: Competitor Content Analysis (3), Engagement Metrics Baseline (13)  
Action: Identify content gaps and high-performing formats  
Produces: Competitor Benchmarking Report  
Stores/Sends To: Google Drive  

**Step 3**: KPI Alignment Workshop  
Uses: KPI Definitions (5), Engagement Metrics Baseline (13)  
Action: Map campaign goals to measurable metrics  
Produces: KPI Alignment Matrix  
Stores/Sends To: Stakeholder Portal  

**Step 4**: Content Calendar Development  
Uses: Campaign Timeline (8), Content Calendar (12)  
Action: Map content formats to channels and deadlines  
Produces: Finalized Content Calendar (5)  
Stores/Sends To: Asana/Trello  

**Step 5**: Content Creation  
Uses: Brand Guidelines (4), Channel-Specific Requirements (6)  
Action: Produce blog posts, videos, and social assets with compliance checks  
Produces: Content Asset Repository (2)  
Stores/Sends To: Digital Asset Management (DAM) System  

**Step 6**: Pre-Launch Compliance Audit  
Uses: Regulatory Compliance Rules (10), Content Asset Repository (2)  
Action: Validate disclosures and terminology  
Produces: Compliance Audit Report (6)  
Stores/Sends To: Legal Team Portal  

**Step 7**: Multi-Channel Distribution  
Uses: Content Calendar (12), Budget Allocation (7)  
Action: Schedule posts and activate paid campaigns  
Produces: CMS Update Log (4)  
Stores/Sends To: WordPress Admin / Meta Ads Manager  

**Step 8**: Performance Monitoring  
Uses: Website Analytics (9), KPI Alignment Matrix (3)  
Action: Track metrics against benchmarks daily  
Produces: Cross-Channel Analytics Dashboard (3)  
Stores/Sends To: Google Data Studio  

**Step 9**: Iterative Optimization  
Uses: Engagement Metrics Baseline (13), Performance Monitoring (8)  
Action: A/B test headlines, reallocate budget to top channels  
Produces: Updated Content Strategy (PDF)  
Stores/Sends To: Marketing Team Inbox  

--- 

[DEPTH STOP CONDITIONS MET: All DERIVABLE inputs (11, 12, 13) decomposed into USER/SYSTEM sources]  
[DEPENDENCY CONSISTENCY CHECK: All inputs used in steps; no implicit sources]
